gw.api.iso

Class ISOProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.iso.ISOProperties

  • public class ISOProperties
extends java.lang.Object
    Configurable properties used when generating ISO requests or receiving ISO responses

    • Method Detail

      • instance

        public static ISOProperties instance()
        Gets the instance of the ISO properties, by default it will not reload the property file.

        This method only returns a valid ISOProperties object if the ISO messaging destination is enabled. If not it will return null. Enabling the ISO messaging destination causes the server to read and validate the ISO configuration, including the properties, at start up

        Returns:
        the singleton ISOProperties object

      • instance

        public static ISOProperties instance(boolean reload)
        Gets the instance of ISO properties, will reload the property file if reload flag is set to true.

        This method only returns a valid ISOProperties object if the ISO messaging destination is enabled. If not it will return null. Enabling the ISO messaging destination causes the server to read and validate the ISO configuration, including the properties, at start up

        Parameters:
        reload - whether or not to reload the properties
        Returns:
        the singleton ISOProperties object

      • read

        public static ISOProperties read(java.io.File file)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 com.guidewire.cc.system.integration.messaging.iso.ISOConfigurationException
        Read an ISO property file. Check that all the required fields are present and that any boolean properties are either omitted entirely or are equal to true or false. External property substitution occurs before consuming the file.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to be read
        Returns:
        the ISO properties
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if cannot open or read the file
        com.guidewire.cc.system.integration.messaging.iso.ISOConfigurationException - if the file cannot be parsed as a property file, is missing required properties or contains malformed boolean properties

        Get a File object for a named file in the ISO configuration directory
        Parameters:
        name - the name of thie file
        Returns:
        the file object with the given name in the ISO configurtion directory

      • shouldSendMessages

        public boolean shouldSendMessages()
        Should message transport send messages to ISO? Should always be true in production. If false the transport just drops messages on the ground - so this property is usually only set to false if message logging is turned on Defaults to true.
        Returns:
        should message transport send messages to ISO?
        See Also:
        getLogMessagesDir()

      • shouldExpectResponses

        public boolean shouldExpectResponses()
        Should the message transport expect replies from ISO? Should always be true in production. If false the message transport will send messages to ISO in test mode, which won't generate any responses, or add anything to their database. But the transport will get an immediate "receipt" from ISO which makes sure that the connection to ISO worked and that the XML syntax and authentication info are correct.

        Defaults to true. Always returns false if shouldSendMessages() is false (even if the field is set in the property file) because it doesn't make sense to expect responses if we're not even sending messages.

        Returns:
        Should the message transport expect replies from ISO?

      • getTestSuffix

        public long getTestSuffix()
        A number which is appended to various fields on every request (the request id, claim number, policy number and insured's name) in order to make them unique in the ISO test database. Otherwise the results from one set of testing could interfere with the results from another set. Only for use when testing. Defaults to 0, which is what it should be for production. When testing you should usually start with this number at 1 and then increment it every time you drop a database and re-import data. If you don't then ISO will reject all the sample data exposures because it will think it has seen them already. To help automatic testing this value can be a long value of up to 12 digits - which means it can be set to the value of System.currentTimeMillis() (at least for the next few hundred years). One restriction, for backwards compatibility reasons: unless the id is zero the bottom 16 bits of the value cannot be zero.
        Returns:
        number to use as test suffix

      • getLogMessagesDir

        public java.lang.String getLogMessagesDir()
        If non null then must be the name of a directory to which all the outgoing and incoming ISO XML messages should be logged. Defaults to null
        Returns:
        the name of a directory for logging ISO messages, or null

      • getMessageLogger

        public ISOMessageLogger getMessageLogger()
        Can be used to log xml messages to the directory given by getLogMessagesDir()
        Returns:
        logger object, for logging ISO messages to a directory

      • getCustomerPassword

        public java.lang.String getCustomerPassword()
        Customer password, as allocated to the customer by ISO. This is a required property with no default value, so it must be specified in ISO.properties. ISO customer passwords are at most 8 characters long.
        Returns:
        customer password

        Returns:

      • getClaimExposureNumberSeparator

        public java.lang.String getClaimExposureNumberSeparator()
        The separator string used to separate the claim number from the exposure order number when building a unique identifier for an exposure. This unique identifier is what will be sent to ISO. For example, if the separator is "exp" the unique identifier for exposure 1 on claim 123-45-6789 would be 123-45-6789exp1. ISO strips out all non alphanumeric characters from the unique identifier, (so the example above will be 123456789exp1 after processing by ISO) so the separator should typically be alphanumeric.
        Returns:
        separator string

      • getOrg

        public java.lang.String getOrg()
        Client application ISO Organization code, defaults to ISO
        Returns:
        organization code

      • getISO_Http_Authentication_Basic_Username

        public java.lang.String getISO_Http_Authentication_Basic_Username()
        The HTTP Basic Authentication username to be attached to the outgoing HTTP request that is sent to ISO. In conjunction with the password, this will result in a request header of the form "Authorization: Basic ..abase64encodedvalue.."
        Returns:
        username to attach, if defined

      • getISO_Http_Authentication_Basic_Password

        public java.lang.String getISO_Http_Authentication_Basic_Password()
        The HTTP Basic Authentication password to be attached to the outgoing HTTP request that is sent to ISO In conjunction with the username, this will result in a request header of the form "Authorization: Basic ..abase64encodedvalue.."
        Returns:
        password to attach, if defined

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Client application name, can be XML_TEST when testing but a real value, allocated by ISO, will be needed when running in production.This is a required property with no default value, so it must be specified in ISO.properties.
        Returns:
        application name
